fields.fieldDescription: The Record ID (RID) that uniquely identifies this schedule.
The number of transactions released.
The Record ID (RID) for the owner.
The code for the owner type. This may be a facility (FAC) or an outstanding (OST)
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
"Represents the current state of the schedule (e.g., released or needs review)."
Indicates the type of schedule, e.g., the facility increase/decrease schedule, loan principal only schedule, loan fixed (principal and interest) schedule, etc.
For a fixed payment schedule for an outstanding, indicates the minimum multiple when generating the schedule, the fixed payment amount must be a multiple of this amount.
Indicates whether or not the borrower is to be billed.
The number of billing days.
The textual description of the schedule type.
Number of periods over which the outstanding is amoritzed when calculating the fixed amount for a fixed (principal and interest) outstanding repayment schedule.
The due date of the first schedule payment at the time this schedule was created.

For a Fixed (Principal and Interest) schedule for an outstanding, a user entered amount which overrides the system calculated fixed payment amount. For a Principal Plus Interest schedule for an outstanding, the user entered fixed principal amount to be paid on each scheduled date.
An amount of principal which, although it is used in determining the interest discount factor for the system calculated fixed payment amount, is not paid until the last scheduled payment.

True indicates that the interest portion of a fixed (principal and interest) outstanding repayment schedule is to be billed regardless of whether it is less than the interest cycle due. False indicates the interest cycle due should be billed.
A threshold unscheduled payment amount for determining whether to reamortize a fixed payment schedule, thus calculating a new fixed payment amount, when an unscheduled payment is made
The date through which amortization was done when calculating the fixed amount for a fixed payment loan repayment schedule

FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY The data in this field is meaningful only if the loan fixed payment repayment schedule has a user-entered fixed payment amount and has an unreleased, unscheduled principal payment which is more than the Unscheduled Payment Reamortization Threshold. It is the fixed payment amount to which the schedule will revert if the unscheduled payment is deleted.

Indicates whether the final principal payment should be auto-charged. Y = auto-charge. N = do not auto-charge. Applicable only to outstanding level repayment schedules (not facility level) and only for certain outstanding types.
N/A
The Branch Identifier
